data.title: Dance Expressions
data.meta_description: Meet our dance teachers and learn about their own dance journey. We are very fortunate to have such a talented group of instructors!
data.text:
Mrs. Lori has been training in dance since the age of 7. She obtained a degree in dance in 1997 and opened the doors of Dance Expressions in the fall. Dance Expressions is celebrating its 27th season.

During her early years in school, she was very active in local dance teams as well as being a junior high cheerleader. She was first on a youth team of 80 dancers. She then danced with a highly competitive junior and senior team growing up traveling as far as NY to compete. She was also on her high school dance team. She was the captain of all 4 teams. Lori graduated from Wayne High School in 1991. Throughout her college years she was on the following semi-pro and professional cheer and dance teams; The Dayton Wings Fly-girls (basketball), Columbus Crew Crewzers (Soccer), The Dayton Cowboys (football). In 1994 her WSU Dance Team traveled to NCA Nationals in Dallas was ranked 2nd in the nation. Lori served on the Showcase America Board of Directors for 24 years. She started judging for Showcase at the age of 20. She currently travels the country judging for NEXSTAR National Talent Competition. In her 20’s she worked with more than a dozen local teams all summer long, as well as being the head instructor for Showcase Camps in 2000 and Director of the year in year in 2000.

Lori recently retired, after 26 years with the Butler Kickline as their coach/choreographer. She started as a 19-year-old Director and took them from a football season drill team to a nationally recognized, trailblazing, highly decorated dance team. They can be proud of endless awards, medals and titles plus having many a dancer go on to dance in college on their teams or in their programs. A couple Ben-gal cheerleaders and a Chicago Bull Cheerleader highlight the list as well as Miss Lauren receiving her degree in dance and Miss Ali taking all that learned during a very disciplined dance era and climbing the status charts as highly sought out stylist recently working on a Lady Gaga video. Lori credits the Butler Kickline and the early parent groups for her love of dance, team and teaching, therefore leading to starting her own dance studio.

In recent years, traveling all over to compete with various studio based circuits the teams and individuals have been awarded some very prestigious titles; Best Choreography, Artistic Excellence (highest score out of 360 routines), Best Technique, Most Entertaining, Best in Industry, Studio of Excellence for 3 years straight and several routines winning titles that then enter a season long database, competing for overall power rankings in several states.

Lori credits a fabulous staff (past and present) and their dedication to the kids and their art for the growth of her business and teams. She thanks her family; Jon, Morgan (CJ c/o 20), Logan (CJ c/o 19), Reagan (BHS c/o 26) for all of their help, love and endless support!

Sarah has been dancing since the age of three. Her background includes Jazz, Lyrical, Tap, Contemporary, Modern, Ballet, and Hip-Hop. In addition to her studio training, she spent years in competitive dance, holding the position of officer for multiple seasons and Captain her senior year where she was nationally ranked in leadership. Her team also was highly ranked winning National titles in the Officer, Jazz, and Lyrical categories. After her graduation from Northmont High School, Sarah continued her dance career by auditioning and being selected for the Wright State University dance department. While there, she trained under very respected and disciplined faculty, and appeared in multiple dance concerts and student productions. Sarah received her degree in fine & performing arts in 2006. After graduation Sarah was thrilled to travel to Las Vegas in the fall of 2006 for THE PULSE dance convention sponsored by Broadway Dance Center of NYC. She trained in all styles on dance from many of the celebrated choreographers of the hit TV show, So You Think You Can Dance. Sarah coached and choreographed for the Vantasia Dance Team for 14 years. The Vantasia Dance Team name left an incredible competitive legacy for hundreds of alumni to be proud of. The team won numerous awards and National titles in the Showcase America Unlimited, Ameridance, NexStar, Masquerade & Kids Artistic Revue competition circuits, including 5 Showcase National Grand Champion titles, and 17 National Gold medals in the officer and team categories. A highlight from her Vantasia career was the team making Showcase Nationals history winning the Best of the Best bronze, silver, and gold medals in 2013. In addition, she is also celebrating her 18th year on staff at Dance Expressions Dance Studio where she is a 4th year coach/choreographer for the reigning Junior National Grand Champion Junior Expressions, Senior Expressions, and multiple competitive soloists. She is also a coach/choreographer for the Butler Kickline. Over the years, her students have enjoyed much success and continue to show growth and excel in technique, style, and performance. Sarah has 4 personal dogs, has fostered 31 dogs and counting, and works heavily in the animal welfare & rescue field.

Miss Lacey was born in Indianapolis, IN and was raised in Dayton, OH. She found her love for dance in high school and decided to continue her dancing career on the Wright State University Dance Team. During her 4.5 years on the team, Miss Lacey served as president and captain of the WSUDT for 3.5 years. She participated in 4 NDA College Dance Camps in Louisville, KY; Boston, MA; and Dayton, OH. She was awarded NDA All-American for her performance in the WSUDT's jazz, hip hop, and pom game day routine. Miss Lacey competed nationally with her WSU Dance Team at NDA College Nationals 4 times, competing in division 1 hip hop, jazz, pom, contemporary, and game day styles. She has had the pleasure of working with guest choreographers such as Sheryl Knight, Joshua "Hazmat" Ulep, and Aj "Headache" Pak to name a few. Lacey graduated from Wright State University, with a Bachelor's in Art with a minor in studio art and a certification in arts management. Lacey is also the current Track & Field throwing coach at Tipp City High School and is also on staff with the Arcanum High School Colorguard. This is Lacey's 3rd year with Dance Expressions and she is so excited to see her students again and meet new ones.

Torre enjoyed her first 15 years at Dance Expressions as a student participating in a variety of classes. Her sisters were part of the inaugural year at Dance Expressions, so the family has been with Lori for 25 years. During Torre’s years with the studio she spent 12 years competing on team, trio and solo levels. Throughout her competition years, Torre served many officer positions including Captain of the Junior and Senior dance teams and was won the title of Miss Showcase of Stars in 2012 (Junior Select Division) and 2017 (Senior Select Division). She was a Captain of the Year and recognized within the Showcase America organization many times. Torre was a key member of many groups winning several titles within the studio groups. One particular number “Interactions” won Best in Show at Masquerade and then later they group was invited to perform with the Dance Contemporary Dance Company. After graduation, Torre was a member of the University of Cincinnati Dance Team and received the “Rookie of the Year” designation. She received her bachelor’s degree in the Spring of 2022 and will begin her master’s program in Speech Pathology in the Fall. Torre continues to enjoy her passion for dance through choreographing and coaching the Dance Expressions Dance Teams.

Reagan Downey is a sophomore at Vandalia-Butler Highschool where she is the Lieutenant on the Butler Kickline. She has been dancing at Dance Expressions since she was 2.5 years old. Reagan is the recent two-time captain of the Junior Elite Expressions and is formerly the captain of the Tiny’s and Mini’s. She has also been a member of the Senior Expressions since 5th grade. Reagan has a variety of summer intensive training throughout the years including working with The Ohio State Dance Team. Most recently, she traveled to California for a weeklong summer intensive at Project 21, training with over 20 celebrity artists. Reagan has been a heavily decorated soloist since Kindergarten with titles such as Primary and Junior Miss Select Showcase of Stars, Miss Teen winner for KAR 2022 & Applause 2023, Turn It Up Dance Challenge’s 2019 “Heart of Gold” recipient, and was chosen for Masquerade’s “Parade of Stars” in 2022. Reagan loved working with our Tiny Team & Mini Hip Hop last year as well as mentoring several soloists. She is now in a choreographer role with 2 soloists, plus her student coaching and is teaching 2 classes.

Brianne started dancing with Dance Expressions when she was 5 years old and will celebrate her 16th season with us in 2023-2024. She was a member of all of our competition teams as well as the Butler Kickline. She was a successful soloist as well. Since graduating H.S, she was an assistant to the newly formed Mini Expressions B team. The following year she took it over (now the Junior Expressions B team) and was an incredible asset in leading that brand new group to much success in their Showcase season and their studio circuit season. She looks forward to this next season with an even bigger group. She is a junior at the University of Cincinnati majoring in biology with the hopes of becoming a Physicians Assistant in Pediatrics. She is excited to be a member of the staff and to be able to work with all of our amazing students.

Taryn was a student at Dance Expressions for 15 years and was in a coaching/teaching/choreographer role for several years in High School. She moved into a teaching role last year as a freshman in college & instructed a tumbling, lyrical and jazz class. During her time as a student and a competition team member she was always an officer and a captain her 8th grade and senior year, leading her team to a gold medal at Showcase America Nationals. She was a successful soloist for 11 years & always in the Top Five every year she competed. Miss Taryn won the title of Elementary Miss Showcase when in 2014 as well as the title of Miss Masquerade. She is now a sophomore at the University of Dayton where she spent her freshman year dancing on the University of Dayton Dance Ensemble. She is pursuing a major in political science and a minor in communications with plans to get a master’s in public administration.

Haleigh was born and raised in Vandalia, Ohio and began her dance career at the age of three at Dance Expressions. She was a member of the Tiny Expressions where she served as Officer and the Mini Expressions, where she served as Officer and Lieutenant. Haleigh spent one year on the Vantasia Dance Team then spent five years on the Senior Expressions where she served as Co-Captain her senior year. In addition, Haleigh spent 4 years on the Butler Kickline, holding many different positions such as Co-Caption her sophomore year and Captain her junior and senior year. Haleigh was a soloist for 12 years competing in different jazz, lyrical, and contemporary numbers. She won the title of Miss Senior Select Showcase of Stars in 2019 as a sophomore. Currently, Haleigh is studying Theater, Dance, and Performance Technology at the University of Dayton in hopes to begin her professional career. As well, she has been a solo choreographer for the past four years. Haleigh had a blast in the summer of 2023 working at an Indiana Amusement Park as a dance and skate performer. She is very excited to begin her second-year teaching classes!
